update.description:
* Start cleaning up unit test dependencies

* Remove gazebo_common requirement in AutoLogFixture, though logging will only work if if test/util.hh is included after gazebo/common/Console.hh

* Fix compilation and change ifdef to match the macro that is used

* Set TEST_DEPENDENCIES for transport unit tests

* link server_fixture with libgazebo, add server_fixture dependency to false unit tests in physics, rendering, and sensors; physics test are currently broken

* Use new fixure library name

* Missed one

* pimpl

* Get, ign-math

* std mutex

* Use AutoLogFixture for Battery_TEST instead of ServerFixture

* Revert change to test/util.hh, don't use AutoLogFixture in gazebo math tests

* Use AutoLogFixture in RenderingConversions_TEST instead of ServerFixture

* Set TEST_DEPENDENCIES for ode and bullet tests

* Separate AutoLogFixture tests from ServerFixture tests in physics, convert Inertial_TEST to AutoLogFixture

* Fix linking of RAMLibrary_TEST.cc

* Add TEST_LIBRARIES variable that will be linked, so that TEST_DEPENDENCIES is just a dependency

* Set TEST_LIBRARIES for INTEGRATION and REGRESSION tests

* Set TEST_DEPENDENCIES for UNIT_gz_TEST

* Don't link Noise and BulletTypes unit tests with gazebo_test_fixture

* Link tests with pthread on UNIX since gtest uses it

* Fix linking of examples test

* Add comment about gtest using pthread on UNIX

* Revert some changes to test/performance/CMakeLists.txt since pthread linking was added to GazeboTestUtils

* Redact use of TEST_DEPENDENCIES for now, save it for a later pull request

* Move cmake variable into macro parameter

* deprecated functions

* gazebo math

* removed duplicate include

* cppcheck

* Remove unneeded add_dependencies call, which causes cmake 3 warnings

* support saving and spawning model with same name

* changelog

* Close branch pimpl_model_creator

* style

* Close branch edit_spawn_same_name_7

* Close branch unit_test_dependencies

* Created new branch Add-hover-state-to-Palette-tabs

* added mouse hover over palette names
update.title: Add hover state to palette tabs
update.reason: Please branch off the plotting branch and target that branch in the pull request.

pull_request.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

pullrequest.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

content.raw:
+1

@almin ,  `plotting` is the branch you'd want to target with these features. Thanks!
content.html:
+1

@almin , plotting is the branch you'd want to target with these features. Thanks!

pull_request.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

pullrequest.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

content.raw: It's hard to see what the changes are in this PR. I am guessing it's mostly in ` gazebo/gui/style.qss`? In that case, I think it's ok to just branch off the `plotting` branch and create a PR with only those changes.
content.html: It's hard to see what the changes are in this PR. I am guessing it's mostly in gazebo/gui/style.qss? In that case, I think it's ok to just branch off the plotting branch and create a PR with only those changes.

pull_request.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

pullrequest.title: Add hover state to palette tabs

content.raw:
Thanks for the contribution!

The diff in this pull request looks larger than it needs to be. I think the source branch was branched off `default` rather than `plot_p5`. We could either:

1. Decline this pull request and make a new one, but this time in a branch coming from `plot_p5`

1. @iche033 , what do you think about syncing `default` and `plotting`?
content.html:
Thanks for the contribution!

The diff in this pull request looks larger than it needs to be. I think the source branch was branched off default rather than plot_p5. We could either:

  1. Decline this pull request and make a new one, but this time in a branch coming from plot_p5

  2. @iche033 , what do you think about syncing default and plotting?

pull_request.title: Add hover state to palette tabs
